intro: Hypocalymma serrulatum, commonly known as the serrated hypocalymma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant has narrow, serrated leaves and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands. It is adapted to dry conditions and is an important component of its native ecosystem. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in suitable climates.
